page.title: 01Tadcaster North Yorkshire
page.content: The most prominent feature of this D-block is the township of Tadcaster, standing abreast the lower reaches of the River Wharfe at the point at which the old Roman road from Pontefract to York crosses it. It has a{population}of approximately 10 000 people who mainly find{ {employment}in the{brewing}industry. The remainder of the block is predominently arable{farm}land with the exception of two areas occupied by the village of Stutton and by Tadcaster Grammar School. Crossing the block from West to East is the dual carriageway of the by-pass carrying the A64 from Leeds to York and on to Scarborough.
